fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.connector

Interface IPlatformService


  • @SystemService
public interface IPlatformService
    Provides methods for managing platform connectors, including adding, removing, and defining aliases.

    A platform connector can be defined either via configuration files or via this API; this API can be used to build a management interface.

    An alias is a preferred endpoint for a connector that the platform service will use to automatically replace a specified endpoint for a connector.

    An alias will automatically update endpoint information for replaceable endpoints (either already-defined, or defined later). Such replacement will be reflected in configuration files (it cannot be undone without updating configuration, either via the API or via configuration files). However, the attachment attributes of the associated connector are not affected.

    Therefore, by using aliases, you can import connector settings from application development environments to production environments, without accidentally clobbering the configuration of connectors on the production server.

    Note: a preferred endpoint cannot also be defined as a replaceable endpoint.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Detail

      • addConnector

        void addConnector(String connectorEndPoint)
        Adds a reference to a connector as a HTTP endpoint. This method is idempotent: adding the same connector endpoint more than once will only add one reference to the connector.

        If there is a preferred endpoint form for this connector, then the specified endpoint address will be converted to the preferred form before attempting to add the connector.

        Parameters:
        connectorEndPoint - the HTTP address of the connector to add, in the form "protocol://hostname:port/basePath". The connector reference will be added asynchronously. It does not need be reachable when added.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if connectorEndPoint is not a valid end point URL.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addConnector(String, java.io.InputStream), removeConnector(String), removeConnector(IHttpEndPoint)

      • addConnector

        void addConnector(String connectorEndPoint,
                  InputStream stream)
           throws IOException
        Adds a reference to a connector as a HTTP endpoint by importing configuration information. This method is idempotent: if the attachId for the platform connector in the imported configuration is already defined for this platform service instance, then calling this method will apply the imported configuration to the same connector (where same means having the same attachId).

        If there is a preferred endpoint form for this connector, then the specified endpoint address will be converted to the preferred form before attempting to add the connector.

        If connectorEndPoint is specified, it overrides the value in the imported stream; specifying this parameter is therefore optional.

        Parameters:
        connectorEndPoint - the optional HTTP address of the connector to add, if the endpoint specified in the imported stream should be overridden (for example, if a development server URL is exported, it may be useful to override it with a production server URL here). If specified (not null or empty, then the address must be in the form "protocol://hostname:port/basePath".

        The connector reference will be added asynchronously. It does not need be reachable when added.

        If overriding is not required, then this parameter may be null.

        stream - contains the non-null connector configuration information to import. The stream will be closed when this method returns normally.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if connectorEndPoint is specified and is not a valid end point URL.
        IOException - if importing the configuration information failed.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addConnector(String), IPlatformConnector.exportConnector(java.io.OutputStream)

      • removeConnector

        void removeConnector(String connectorEndPoint)
        Removes a reference to a connector as a HTTP endpoint. This method is idempotent: removing an already-removed connector has no effect.

        If there is a preferred endpoint form for this connector, then the specified endpoint address will be converted to the preferred form before attempting to remove it.

        Parameters:
        connectorEndPoint - the HTTP address of the connector to remove, in the form "protocol://hostname:port/basePath".
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if connectorEndPoint is not a valid end point URL.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addConnector(String), removeConnector(IHttpEndPoint)

      • removeConnector

        void removeConnector(IHttpEndPoint connectorEndPoint)
        Removes a reference to a connector by reference. This method is idempotent: removing an already-removed connector has no effect.

        If there is a preferred endpoint form for this connector, then the specified endpoint address will be converted to the preferred form before attempting to remove it.

        Parameters:
        connectorEndPoint - the endpoint. Can also be an instance of IPlatformConnector.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if connectorEndPoint is not a valid end point URL.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addConnector(String), removeConnector(String)

      • setPreferredEndPoint

        void setPreferredEndPoint(String whenEndPoint,
                          String useEndPoint)
        Configures the platform service to replace all occurrences of a specific endpoint address with a preferred endpoint address. For example, on a production server, this can be configured to avoid accidentally using a development platform server instead of the production server.
        Parameters:
        whenEndPoint - the replaceable endpoint, in the form "protocol://hostname:port/basePath".
        useEndPoint - the preferred endpoint, or null to stop using an alias (previously-replaced endpoints are not converted back to their original form).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the end points are not valid URLs.
        IllegalStateException - if whenEndPoint is already defined as being a preferred connector endpoint, or when useEndPoint is already defined as being replaceable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getPreferredEndPoint(String), getReplaceableEndPoints()

      • getPreferredEndPoint

        IHttpEndPoint getPreferredEndPoint(String whenEndPoint)
        Gets the preferred endpoint address for a specified endpoint address.
        Parameters:
        whenEndPoint - the replaceable endpoint, in the form "protocol://hostname:port/basePath".
        Returns:
        the preferred endpoint address for a specified endpoint address, if there is a matching preferred endpoint, or returns the supplied endpoint as specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the end point is not a valid URL.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getPreferredEndPoint(IHttpEndPoint)

      • getPreferredEndPoint

        IHttpEndPoint getPreferredEndPoint(IHttpEndPoint whenEndPoint)
        Gets the preferred endpoint address for a specified endpoint address.
        Parameters:
        whenEndPoint - the replaceable endpoint.
        Returns:
        the preferred endpoint address for a specified endpoint address, if there is a matching preferred endpoint, or returns the supplied endpoint as specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the end point is not a valid URL.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getReplaceableEndPoints

        List<IHttpEndPoint> getReplaceableEndPoints()
        Gets all endpoints that have been configured as replaceable by preferred endpoints.
        Returns:
        the list of replaceable endpoints, or an empty list.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setPreferredEndPoint(String, String), getPreferredEndPoint(IHttpEndPoint)
